intro: Eriastrum brandegeeae, commonly known as the Brandegee's eriam. It is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Eriastrum brandegeeae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
